when_to_say: Used as a greeting in a polite context.
example: 안녕하세요, 어떻게 지내세요? (annyeonghaseyo, eotteoke jinaeseyo?) - Hello, how are you?

when_to_say: Used to express gratitude in formal settings.
example: 감사합니다, 도와주셔서 감사합니다. (gamsahamnida, dowajusyeoseo gamsahamnida) - Thank you, thank you for helping.

when_to_say: Used to apologize formally.
example: 죄송합니다, 늦었습니다. (joesonghamnida, neujeosseumnida) - I'm sorry, I am late.

when_to_say: Used as a confirmation or affirmative response.
example: 네, 알겠습니다. (ne, algesseumnida) - Yes, I understand.

when_to_say: Used as a negative response.
example: 아니요, 저는 그곳에 가지 않아요. (aniyo, jeoneun geose gaji anayo) - No, I will not go there.

when_to_say: Used to refer to water.
example: 물 한 잔 주세요. (mul han jan juseyo) - Please give me a glass of water.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a book.
example: 책을 읽고 있어요. (chaekeul ilggo isseoyo) - I am reading a book.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a house.
example: 우리 집에 오세요. (uri jibe oseyo) - Please come to our house.

when_to_say: Used to refer to love or affection.
example: 사랑해요. (salanghaeyo) - I love you.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a friend.
example: 저는 제 친구를 만나요. (jeoneun je chingureul mannayo) - I meet my friend.

when_to_say: Used to refer to rice or a meal.
example: 밥을 먹어요. (bapeul meogeoyo) - I eat rice.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a car.
example: 저는 자동차를 타고 있어요. (jeoneun jadongchareul tago isseoyo) - I am riding a car.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a school.
example: 학교에 가요. (hakgyoe gayo) - I am going to school.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a student.
example: 저는 학생이에요. (jeoneun haksaeng-ieyo) - I am a student.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a teacher.
example: 선생님께 물어보세요. (seonsaengnimkke mureoboseyo) - Ask the teacher.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a doctor.
example: 의사에게 가세요. (uisaege gaseyo) - Go to the doctor.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a hospital.
example: 병원에 가야 해요. (byeongwone gaya haeyo) - I need to go to the hospital.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a pharmacy.
example: 약국에 가요. (yakguke gayo) - I am going to the pharmacy.

when_to_say: Used to refer to money.
example: 돈을 잃어버렸어요. (doneul ilheobeoryeosseo) - I lost my money.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the price of something.
example: 이것의 가격은 얼마에요? (igeos-ui gagyeogeun eolmaeyo?) - What is the price of this?

when_to_say: Used to refer to a written letter.
example: 친구에게 편지를 썼어요. (chingu-ege pyeonjireul sseosseoyo) - I wrote a letter to my friend.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a park.
example: 공원에서 산책해요. (gongwoneseo sanchaekhaeyo) - I am taking a walk in the park.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a movie.
example: 영화를 봤어요. (yeonghwareul bwasseoyo) - I watched a movie.

when_to_say: Used to refer to music.
example: 저는 음악을 좋아해요. (jeoneun eumageul joahaeyo) - I like music.

when_to_say: Used to refer to an actor or actress.
example: 그는 유명한 배우예요. (geuneun yumyeonghan baeu-yeyo) - He is a famous actor.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a box.
example: 상자에 책을 넣었어요. (sangjae chaekeul neohosseoyo) - I put the book in the box.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a door.
example: 문을 닫았어요. (muneul datasseoyo) - I closed the door.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a window.
example: 창문을 열었어요. (changmuneul yeoreosseoyo) - I opened the window.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is bright.
example: 그 방은 아주 밝아요. (geu bangeun aju balgayo) - That room is very bright.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is dark.
example: 그 방은 어두워요. (geu bangeun eoduwayo) - That room is dark.

when_to_say: Used to refer to coffee.
example: 저는 커피를 마셔요. (jeoneun keopireul masyeoyo) - I drink coffee.

when_to_say: Used to refer to tea.
example: 차를 마셔요. (chareul masyeoyo) - I drink tea.

when_to_say: Used to refer to morning.
example: 아침에 일어나요. (achime il-eonayo) - I wake up in the morning.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the evening.
example: 저녁에 친구를 만나요. (jeonyeoke chingureul mannayo) - I meet a friend in the evening.

when_to_say: Used to refer to night.
example: 밤에 자요. (bame jayo) - I sleep at night.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the summer season.
example: 여름에는 덥죠. (yeoreumeneun deobjyo) - It is hot in the summer.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the winter season.
example: 겨울에는 춥죠. (gyeoulemeun chubjyo) - It is cold in the winter.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the fall/autumn season.
example: 가을에는 날씨가 좋아요. (ga-euleneun nalssiga johayo) - The weather is nice in the fall.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the spring season.
example: 봄에는 꽃이 피어요. (bomeun kkochi pieoyo) - Flowers bloom in the

when_to_say: Used to refer to the sky.
example: 하늘이 맑아요. (haneuli malgayo) - The sky is clear.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the sea.
example: 바다에 가고 싶어요. (badae gago sipeoyo) - I want to go to the sea.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a mountain.
example: 산에 올라가요. (sane ollagayo) - I am going up the mountain.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a river.
example: 강을 건너요. (gangeul geonneoyo) - I cross the river.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a road or street.
example: 길을 걷고 있어요. (gireul geotgo isseoyo) - I am walking on the road.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a house or home.
example: 저는 집에 있어요. (jeoneun jibe isseoyo) - I am at home.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a school.
example: 학교에 가요. (hakgyoe gayo) - I am going to school.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a classroom.
example: 교실에서 공부해요. (gyosileseo gongbuhaeyo) - I study in the classroom.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a teacher.
example: 선생님이 책을 읽어요. (seonsaengnimi chaekeul ilgeoyo) - The teacher reads the book.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a student.
example: 저는 학생이에요. (jeoneun haksaeng-ieyo) - I am a student.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a problem.
example: 이 문제는 어려워요. (i munjeneun eoryeowoyo) - This problem is difficult.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a class.
example: 수업이 시작돼요. (sueobi sijakdoeyo) - The class is starting.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a test or exam.
example: 시험을 봐요. (siheomeul bwayo) - I take a test.

when_to_say: Used to refer to food.
example: 저는 음식이 좋아요. (jeoneun eumsigi johayo) - I like food.

when_to_say: Used to refer to water.
example: 물을 마셔요. (mureul masyeoyo) - I drink water.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a person.
example: 저는 그 사람을 알아요. (jeoneun geu sarameul arayo) - I know that person.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a friend.
example: 그는 제 친구예요. (geuneun je chingu-yeyo) - He is my friend.

when_to_say: Used to refer to family.
example: 우리 가족은 네 명이에요. (uri gajogeun ne myeong-ieyo) - My family has four members.

when_to_say: Used to refer to siblings.
example: 저는 형제가 없어요. (jeoneun hyeongje-ga eopseoyo) - I don't have siblings.

when_to_say: Used to refer to language.
example: 저는 한국어를 배워요. (jeoneun hangugeoreul baewoyo) - I am learning Korean.

when_to_say: Used when referring to reading.
example: 책을 읽어요. (chaekeul ilgeoyo) - I read a book.

when_to_say: Used when referring to writing.
example: 편지를 써요. (pyeonjireul sseoyo) - I write a letter.

when_to_say: Used when referring to eating.
example: 저는 밥을 먹어요. (jeoneun babeul meogeoyo) - I eat rice.

when_to_say: Used when referring to going somewhere.
example: 학교에 가요. (hakgyoe gayo) - I go to school.

when_to_say: Used when referring to coming somewhere.
example: 집에 와요. (jibe wayo) - I come home.

when_to_say: Used when referring to sleeping.
example: 저는 일찍 자요. (jeoneun iljjik jayo) - I sleep early.

when_to_say: Used when referring to seeing or watching.
example: 영화를 봐요. (yeonghwareul bwayo) - I watch a movie.

when_to_say: Used when referring to listening.
example: 음악을 들어요. (eumageul deureoyo) - I listen to music.

when_to_say: Used when referring to knowing something.
example: 저는 그 사람을 알아요. (jeoneun geu sarameul arayo) - I know that person.

when_to_say: Used when referring to not knowing something.
example: 저는 그 문제를 몰라요. (jeoneun geu munjereul mollayo) - I don't know that problem.

when_to_say: Used when referring to buying something.
example: 책을 사요. (chaekeul sayo) - I buy a book.

when_to_say: Used when referring to selling something.
example: 저는 과일을 팔아요. (jeoneun gwairureul parayo) - I sell fruits.

when_to_say: Used when referring to giving something.
example: 저는 선물을 줘요. (jeoneun seonmureul jwoyo) - I give a gift.

when_to_say: Used when referring to receiving something.
example: 저는 선물을 받아요. (jeoneun seonmureul badayo) - I receive a gift.

when_to_say: Used to describe frequency.
example: 저는 자주 운동해요. (jeoneun jaju undonghaeyo) - I exercise often.

when_to_say: Used to describe occasional frequency.
example: 저는 가끔 영화를 봐요. (jeoneun gakkeum yeonghwareul bwayo) - I sometimes watch movies.

when_to_say: Used to describe habitual frequency.
example: 저는 늘 아침에 운동해요. (jeoneun neul achime undonghaeyo) - I always exercise in the morning.

when_to_say: Used to refer to today.
example: 오늘은 날씨가 좋아요. (oneureun nalssiga johayo) - The weather is good today.

when_to_say: Used to refer to tomorrow.
example: 내일은 친구를 만나요. (naeil-eun chingureul mannayo) - I will meet my friend tomorrow.

when_to_say: Used to refer to yesterday.
example: 어제는 비가 왔어요. (eoje-neun biga wasseoyo) - It rained yesterday.

when_to_say: Used to describe something good or nice.
example: 이 영화는 정말 좋아요. (i yeonghwaneun jeongmal johayo) - This movie is really good.

when_to_say: Used to describe something bad.
example: 이 음식은 나빠요. (i eumsigeun nappayo) - This food is bad.

when_to_say: Used to describe something small.
example: 이 가방은 작아요. (i gabangeun jakayo) - This bag is small.

when_to_say: Used to describe something big.
example: 이 집은 커요. (i jibeun keoyo) - This house is big.

when_to_say: Used to describe something abundant.
example: 사람이 많아요. (sarami manayo) - There are many people.

when_to_say: Used to describe something few or little.
example: 학생이 적어요. (haksaengi jeogeoyo) - There are few students.

when_to_say: Used when you like something.
example: 저는 음악을 좋아해요. (jeoneun eumageul joahaeyo) - I like music.

when_to_say: Used when you dislike something.
example: 저는 그 음식을 싫어해요. (jeoneun geu eumsigeul silheohaeyo) - I dislike that food.

when_to_say: Used when you are busy.
example: 저는 오늘 바빠요. (jeoneun oneul bappayo) - I am busy today.

when_to_say: Used when you are tired.
example: 저는 피곤해요. (jeoneun pigonhaeyo) - I am tired.

when_to_say: Used when you walk.
example: 저는 매일 걷어요. (jeoneun maeil geodeoyo) - I walk every day.

when_to_say: Used when you run.
example: 저는 아침에 달려요. (jeoneun achime dallyeoyo) - I run in the morning.

when_to_say: Used when looking at or seeing something.
example: 저는 새로운 영화를 봐요. (jeoneun saeroun yeonghwareul bwayo) - I watch a new movie.

when_to_say: Used when taking a photo.
example: 저는 사진을 찍어요. (jeoneun sajineul jjigeoyo) - I take a photo.

when_to_say: Used when writing something.
example: 저는 일기를 써요. (jeoneun ilgireul sseoyo) - I write in my diary.

when_to_say: Used when you are worried about something.
example: 저는 시험이 걱정돼요. (jeoneun siheomi geokjeongdwayo) - I am worried about the exam.

when_to_say: Used to refer to music.
example: 저는 음악을 듣는 것을 좋아해요. (jeoneun eumageul deutneun geoseul joahaeyo) - I like listening to music.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a book.
example: 이 책은 정말 재밌어요. (i chaegeun jeongmal jaemisseoyo) - This book is really interesting.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a newspaper.
example: 저는 아침에 신문을 읽어요. (jeoneun achime sinmuneul ilgeoyo) - I read the newspaper in the morning.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a television.
example: 저는 밤에 텔레비전을 봐요. (jeoneun bame telebijeoneul bwayo) - I watch television at night.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a computer.
example: 저는 컴퓨터로 일을 해요. (jeoneun keompyuteoro ireul haeyo) - I work on the computer.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a phone call or a telephone.
example: 저는 전화할 시간이 없어요. (jeoneun jeonhwahal sigani eopseoyo) - I don't have time to make a phone call.

when_to_say: Used to refer to an airplane.
example: 비행기를 타고 여행을 가요. (bihaenggireul tago yeohaengeul gayo) - I am going on a trip by airplane.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a bus.
example: 저는 버스를 타고 학교에 가요. (jeoneun beoseureul tago hakgyoe gayo) - I take the bus to go to school.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the subway.
example: 저는 지하철을 타고 출근해요. (jeoneun jihacheoreul tago chulgeunhaeyo) - I take the subway to go to work.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a car.
example: 저는 자동차로 여행을 가요. (jeoneun jadongcharo yeohaengeul gayo) - I am going on a trip by car.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a bicycle.
example: 저는 자전거를 타고 공원에 가요. (jeoneun jajeongeoreul tago gongwone gayo) - I ride a bicycle to the park.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a boat or ship.
example: 저는 배를 타고 섬에 가요. (jeoneun baereul tago seome gayo) - I go to the island by boat.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a road or street.
example: 이 길은 매우 좁아요. (i gireun maeu jobayo) - This road is very narrow.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a person.
example: 저는 그 사람을 알아요. (jeoneun geu sarameul arayo) - I know that person.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a thing or object.
example: 이 물건은 얼마에요? (i mulgeoneun eolmaeyo) - How much is this thing?
